Dear Jennifer Trotter:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 2 cusses at the youth and intimidates them. Staff 2 is related
to the supervisor and never gets into trouble because of this. The
staff member also discusses confidential information from the
youth's files to include medication information with other youth.
Investigation Complainant was anonymous.
Case Manager was interviewed at the facility on 04/09/2025.
Case Manager denied witnessing Staff 2 intimidating youths. Case
Manager said she has heard Staff 2 say “shit” however she is not
sure if she directed this towards the youths. Case Manager
reported there was an incident last month involving Staff 2 making
a remark to Youth B about Youth B’s interaction with her father.
Case Manager said there was a meeting with Staff 2 and Youth B,
and Staff 2 was coached by Supervisor 2 regarding the incident.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 04/09/2025. Youth A
has been at the facility for two years. She reported she does not
like Staff 2 because she is mean. Youth A said she heard Staff 2
say, “I am not fucking talking to you” and also she has heard her
say “I am not dealing with this shit.” Youth A could not recall the
date when she heard Staff 2 cussing. Youth A said Staff 2 had
made a remark to Youth B about her relationship with her father.
She heard Staff 2 telling Youth B, “lets talk about what you did to
your father.” Youth A said last week Staff 2 got mad at her for
slamming a remote control, and when Staff 2 left the facility, Staff
2 turned around before getting in her car and stuck out her middle
finger. Youth A said she told Supervisor 1 about Staff 2 giving her
the middle finger. Youth A reported all her needs are being met
and she had no issues with any other staff member.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 04/09/2025. Youth B
has been at the facility for one month. Youth B reported Staff 2
2

gets away with a lot of things. Youth B said there was an incident
with her and Staff 2 and Youth B called Staff 2 a “dumb ass.”
Staff 2 called Youth B a narcissist and talked about Youth B’s
father. Youth B could not recall what Staff 2 said about her father.
Youth B told Administrator about the incident. Youth B said she
and Staff 2 had a meeting and Staff 2 apologized. Youth B said
Staff 2 told her that all the youths at the facility take crazy
medication except Youth B. Youth B expressed no other concerns
regard staff or the facility.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 04/09/2025. Youth C
reported Staff 2 talked about Youth B’s family and called Youth B
a narcissist. Youth C also said she has heard Staff 2 say the “F”
word, but she is not sure if it was directed at a youth.
Youth D was interviewed at the facility on 04/09/2025. Youth D
reported Staff 2 is mean, and she heard Staff 2 say “I am tired of
these fucking kids.” Youth D denied witnessing or hearing Staff 2
talking about youths’ medication. Youth D reported feeling safe
and did not express any concerns regarding any other staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 04/09/2025. Staff 1
reported that she has heard Staff 2 use inappropriate words in
front of the youths. Staff 1 said there was an incident last week
with Staff 2 and Youth A and Staff 2 did use the word “shit,”
however she is not sure it was directed at the youth. Staff 1
denied hearing Staff 2 talk about youths’ medication. Staff 1
reported that Staff 2 is related to Supervisor 1 by marriage.
Administrator was interviewed via telephone on 04/09/2025.
Administrator reported Staff 2 has been working at the facility for 7
months, Staff 2 is related to Supervisor 1 and that is the reason
Staff 2 reports to Supervisor 2. Administrator reported she is not
aware of any reports regarding Staff 2 cussing or intimidating
youths. She said there was an incident last month regarding Staff
2 making a remark about Youth B’s relationship with her father
and Staff 2 was coached by Supervisor 2.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 04/10/2025. Staff 2 has
been working at the facility for 7 months and completed all new
hire training. Staff 2 denied cussing or intimidating youths. Staff 2
admitted that she sometimes will say “shit” out of frustration, but it
is not directed at the youths. Staff 2 denied discussing youths
confidential/medication information in front of other youths. Staff 2
reported there was an incident last month involving Youth B. She
said Youth B was picking on her, so she told Youth B “I read your
3

file, your pushing my buttons the way you push your father’s
buttons.” Staff 2 could not recall using the word narcissist. She
said she and Youth B met with Supervisor 2 after this incident, she
was coached about what she said to Youth B and apologized to
Youth B. Staff 2 reported she is related to Supervisor 1 by
marriage and does not report to Supervisor 1. Staff 2 said she
reports to Supervisor 2 and denied getting any special treatment.
Staff 2 said she is a no-nonsense person that sometimes
frustrates the youth. She said the Youths are the ones that cuss at
her and denied using the “F” word or intimidating youths.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 04/10/2025.
Supervisor 1 has been working at the facility for 5 years.
Supervisor 1 reported Staff 2 is related to her by marriage, and
that’s why Staff 2 reports to Supervisor 2. She denied that Staff 2
gets any special treatment because of the relationship. She said
there was an incident between Staff 2 and Youth B, and that Staff
2 was coached regarding the incident. Supervisor 1 denied
witnessing Staff 2 intimidate or using inappropriate language with
the youths. She said Youth A did report that on 03/31/2024 when
Staff 2 was leaving she turned around before getting in her vehicle
and stuck out her middle finger. She reviewed video footage for
that day and did not see Staff 2 turn around after walking to her
car or sticking out her middle finger.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via telephone on 04/10/2025.
Supervisor 2 has been working at the facility for 4 years.
Supervisor denied Staff 2 getting any special treatment because
she is related to Supervisor 1. Supervisor 2 reported there was an
incident involving Youth B and Staff 2 making a remark about
Youth B’s relationship with her father. Staff 2 was coached about
the incident and Staff 2 apologized to Youth B. Supervisor 2
denied witnessing or having any reports regarding Staff 2 talking
about youths’ medication or Staff 2 using inappropriate language
with youths.
Video Footage Reviewed:
Video footage dated 03/31/2025 at approximately 7:25 pm Staff 2
is observed walking to her car, unlocking the car, and getting in
the car without turning around. Staff 2 was not observed to be
sticking out her middle finger.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 03/12/2025 written by Supervisor 2.
Youth B reported that a couple days ago Staff 2 told Youth
4

B, “I know what you are doing, you’re pushing my buttons. I
read your file. I know you do that.” Youth B admitted that
she was not following directions and being disrespectful
with Staff 2.
• Incident report dated 03/12/2025 written by Supervisor 2.
Supervisor 2 facilitated a restorative meeting with Staff 2
and Youth B. Staff 2 and Youth B talked about the incident
and they both took responsibility for the things they had
said to each other. Staff 2 apologized to Youth B and Youth
B apologized to Staff 2.
• Staff 2 personnel file: No disciplinary action reports. Staff 2
completed interaction with clients and professional conduct
training on 11/22/2024.
• Girlstown Policy outlining Professional Conduct and Non-
Harassment/Non-Discrimination Policy states the facility is
committed to a work environment in which all individuals
are treated with respect and dignity and employees should
be respectful, courteous, and mindful of others.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance based on documentation
reviewed, and interviews with Staff and Youths. There is sufficient
evidence that Staff 2 used derogatory language and made
negative references regarding a youth’s background.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
